lexUnit.name: kneel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or rest on a knee or the knees.

sentence.text: At the back of the church knelt Mrs Duffy , the school caretaker , saying her beads .
During interrogation some detainees were made to kneel for long periods , in some cases on bottle tops and pebbles , and received severe beatings on their backs , the soles of their feet and hands .
Gosse knelt a moment longer .
The altar-servers , who had been kneeling just moments before , were now half-sitting , half-lying on the platform , arms and elbows outstretched to support them .
A pair of Jacobean Dersinghams , husband and wife in about half life-size , kneeling side by side on a plinth , looked stolidly into eternity .
He knelt as erect as ever at the table .
Adam knelt motionless , glob Ed in fire .
He knelt close by Rory .
Sent up early to the dormitory , I had to kneel naked by the side of my bed .
His knees ached as he knelt there for hours .
For a second or two Ben knelt there in front of him threateningly , his whole body tensed as if to act .
Two of them knelt at her casement , with muskets their side .
Defries knelt at the edge of the rough-hewn , irregularly-shaped hole .
Small took the wheel of a dilapidated pick-up , while two men knelt behind the cab with shotguns .
Nicholas knelt by the body .
He kneels by my head , grinning .
Fand set her spear against the wall and knelt by Ruth , reaching out to touch her hand .
She knelt by the trunk , flinging aside papers , reaching down and down , scrabbling in the corners .
The big Han knelt in the doorway and bowed his head .
And you are kneeling in a field
As I kneel in a kind of mourning , someone calls .
Her greatest dread , however , was that the vicar might suggest that , together , he and Olivia should kneel in prayer .
As the doc knelt in the sand the engine flickered and caught fire with a roar like a trapped animal .
She was naked now , and kneeling on the bed still holding her wine .
She knelt on the floor , heedless of the cold stone beneath her knees .
She would kneel on the floor behind the sofa and pull out the tall books of art reproductions .
She knelt on the cold stone floor and carefully placed some coals on the dying embers in the grate .
Sung was kneeling on the top of the dyke , staring across at the House as the dawn broke .
As we trooped out of the hall , the old lady in the wheelchair was still trying to get up , and Clara Beeding was kneeling in front of her .
Fully clothed , enormous in midnight-blue serge suit and peaked cap , he knelt above her , rhythmically slapping her face with a pendulum action of his heavy-gloved hand .
Kate came to kneel in front of her mother .
He found it and clung there for a while , then pushed clear and knelt among the waves , head lowered .
The people kneeling around her sighed all together , a breath of wonder that rippled through them .
He did not immediately dry his face but knelt over the stream , looking down to where the sun was glinting on the pebbles , turning them momentarily into stars .
I looked back at the rabbit , then got up and knelt over it .
Never bend when you can kneel or squat
The elder brother was shot in the stomach as he knelt pleading for mercy .
